{{also|job|jòb|Jòb}} ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{der|en|la|Iob}}, from {{der|en|grc|Ἰώβ}}, from {{der|en|hbo|אִיּוֹב|tr=ʾiyyōḇ}}, related to {{m|he|אָיַב||to be an enemy|tr=ʾāyaḇ}} and {{m|he|אוֹיֵב||enemy|tr=ʾōyēḇ}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{enPR|jōb}}, {{IPA|en|/dʒəʊb/}} * {{a|colloquial}} {{IPA|en|/d͡ʒɒb/|/d͡ʒɔb/}} * {{rhymes|en|əʊb}} * {{homophones|en|job}} {{gloss|second pronunciation}} ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} {{book of the Bible|Book of Job}} # {{lb|en|biblical}} A book of the [[Old Testament]] and the [[Hebrew]] [[Tanakh]]. # {{given name|en|male|from=Hebrew}} # A character in the [[Old Testament]] and the [[Qur'an]], renowned for his [[patience]]. ====Derived terms==== {{der-top}} * {{l|en|as poor as Job}} * {{l|en|Job's ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m||Jobs}} # a [[task]], an [[assignment]] #: ''Ich hab’ ’nen '''Job''' für dich: Rasenmähen!'' - I have a task for you: mowing the lawn! # [[employment]] ====Usage notes==== This word is always referencing a specified task or employment and is not normally used when talking about one's [[profession]] or [[work]] in general. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|s|s}} ====Related
